messages.message: it looks like build-webpack-js is ran in server-nginx Makefile so I think this is probably ok to delete if that’s where prod copies static files
yes server-nginx runs build-webpack-js and hosts the files from there — sounds good
we need it for local dev
can you check that things work for local docker development when making makefile changes

how do you run webapp locally in Docker btw?

Interesting — is it possible for us to have a separate “build-docker” command for local in this particular case?

Main reason that motivates this: Currently our build process takes a long time for infra. build-webpack-js specifically takes a very long time. And we have it twice right now (server-nginx and webapp) whereas we should only need it for server-nginx when we deploy to prod)
with provisioner script. python provisioner.py compile webapp --as-docker
there is a DEV flag in the makefile, move it so the build-webpack-js dep is inside that flag?
